title: Noam Chomsky - 1988-11-XX - Interviewed by Canadian Journalists at Round Table - Improved audio.
description:
Be sure to pick 720p for best sound and picture quality.
After delivering his lecture series, "Necessary Illusions - Thought Control in Democratic Societies" on Canadian radio, Noam Chomsky took questions from the Canadian press, including a young David Frum. 



Thanks to Digital Chomsky for uploading the original video. 



I did a VERY extensive fixing and cleanup of the audio.  The left/right tracks were out of phase with each other, making the sound muffled.  I fixed that.  Also I did a pretty thorough de-noising, and fixed other small problems - like quieting sudden explosive sounds, making this safe for headphone users - for example at 22:30 - which on the original audio mastering was insanely loud(!). 



I color-corrected the video somewhat and improved the contrast, as well.  Unfortunately, the poor quality of the source limited what could be done.
